description: cock +â€Ž shy; so called from an ancient popular sport which consisted in shying or throwing cudgels at live cocks.

entries.meaning: A game in which trinkets are set upon sticks, to be thrown at by the players.
An object at which stones are flung; (by extension) a person who is abused or vilified.

verbs.description: cockshy (third-person singular simple present cockshies, present participle cockshying, simple past and past participle cockshied)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To pelt; to throw things at.
